messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Puzzling Park Predicament DATE: 08/08/65 The courtroom was a canvas of mixed emotions as the trial delved deeper. The prosecution beckoned the officers pivotal to the investigation to elucidate on their findings. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Captain A. B. Adams, the lead investigator of this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Captain Adams. Could you recount the events on the morning the predicament was discovered? WITNESS: Indeed. On the morning of April 4th, Officer C. D. Clark noticed unusual signs of disturbance in the park and reported it. The investigation commenced at once. PROSECUTOR: Who was in charge of the forensic examination? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Evans and Technician G. H. Hill handled the forensic examination. PROSECUTOR: Who conducted the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Jackson and K. L. Lewis were responsible for interrogating suspects and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense engaged in a cross-examination of Captain Adams concerning the investigative methods employed. During the trial, Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson, Patrol Officer O. P. Owen, and Patrol Officer Q. R. Quinn were also called to testify.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Captain A. B. Adams 
Officer Context: Captain Adams is the lead investigator in the Puzzling Park Predicament case, detailing the events on the morning the predicament was discovered during the trial. 
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Clark 
Officer Context: Officer Clark observed unusual signs of disturbance in the park on the morning of April 4th, which initiated the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Evans 
Officer Context: Sergeant Evans, alongside Technician G. H. Hill, was responsible for handling the forensic examination related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Hill 
Officer Context: Technician Hill worked with Sergeant E. F. Evans on the forensic analysis concerning the unusual disturbances at the park. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Jackson 
Officer Context: Detective Jackson, alongside Detective K. L. Lewis, conducted interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the predicament. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. Lewis 
Officer Context: Detective Lewis, along with Detective I. J. Jackson, was tasked with interrogating individuals to collect additional information about the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Nelson was called to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer O. P. Owen 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Owen was also called to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer Q. R. Quinn 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Quinn was summoned to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer
